data.meanings: day, era, time, today, this/that day, age/period of time.
data.sentence: The word يَوْمًا comes from the root ي و م and is associated with the meanings: day, era, time, today, this/that day, age/period of time.

data.meanings: to be a lord and master, collect, possess/owner, rule, increase, complete, bring up, preserve, chief, determiner, provider, sustainer, perfecter, rewarder, creator, maintainer, reposer of properties, developer, former of rules and laws of the growth, foster a thing in such a manner as to make it attain one condition after another until it reaches its goal of completion.
data.sentence: The word رَبِّنَا comes from the root ر ب ب and is associated with the meanings: to be a lord and master, collect, possess/owner, rule, increase, complete, bring up, preserve, chief, determiner, provider, sustainer, perfecter, rewarder, creator, maintainer, reposer of properties, developer, former of rules and laws of the growth, foster a thing in such a manner as to make it attain one condition after another until it reaches its goal of completion.

data.meanings: To fear, to be afraid/frightened/terrified, to put fear into another, diminish or lessen or take from, to take little by little from a thing, take from the sides of a thing, slaughter or fight.
data.sentence: The word نَخَافُ comes from the root خ و ف and is associated with the meanings: To fear, to be afraid/frightened/terrified, to put fear into another, diminish or lessen or take from, to take little by little from a thing, take from the sides of a thing, slaughter or fight.

data.meanings: to frown, look sternly, austere, grim.
data.sentence: The word عَبُوسًا comes from the root ع ب س and is associated with the meanings: to frown, look sternly, austere, grim.

data.meanings: to frown, scorn, knit the brow, show displeasure or distress.
data.sentence: The word قَمْطَرِيرًا comes from the root ق م ط ر and is associated with the meanings: to frown, scorn, knit the brow, show displeasure or distress.
